HARRIS
v.
N.C. DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC SAFETY 110A17-1 Supreme Court of North Carolina. August 14, 2017 Tamika L. Henderson, Assistant Attorney Geneal, for N.C. Department Of Public Safety. Michael C. Byrne, Attorney at Law, for Harris, Steven. Norris Arden Adams, II, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, E. Hardy Lewis, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, for Fraternal Order of Police, et al. J. Michael McGuinness, Attorney at Law, Elizabethtown, Megan Ashley Milliken, Attorney at Law, for Southern States Police Benevolent Association, et al.

The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 10th of August 2017 by Southern States Police Benevolent Association and the N.C. Police Benevolent Association for leave to file Amicus Curiae Brief:

"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 14th of August 2017."

Unless already submitted, the Amicus Brief shall be submitted to the court within the times allowed and in the manner provided by Appellate Rule 28(i).
